title: AN ACT proposing an amendment to Section 145 of the Constitution of Kentucky relating to voting rights.
subject: Civil Rights
Constitution, Ky.
County Clerks
Crimes and Punishments
Elections and Voting
Secretary of State

abstracts.abstract: Propose to amend Section 145 of the Constitution of Kentucky to automatically restore the voting rights of persons convicted of certain felonies upon completion of their imprisonment, probation, or parole and automatically restore their civil rights five years after completion of their imprisonment, probation, or parole; provide ballot language; submit to voters for ratification or rejection.

actions.description: to Elections, Const. Amendments & Intergovernmental Affairs (H)
